Posted By: mdakw576 (1/6/2010 2:47:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love this card. Fantastic. It's so simple and effective. I love how the way it says it in two simple sentences. "Counter target spell. Draw a card." Yeah sure [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic Command) is better but there is something I just love about this card. Went well in the old school "Draw Go" decks. I really wish they would reprint this for M11 so we can have a decent counterspell in standard. At least give us our [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak)! I have never seen so many request to get a card printed for M11 than I do Mana Leak. We know you hear us wizards! We want our Mana Leak back! I'll take dismiss if you would rather do that, but you need to bring back at least one good counterspell! [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel) and [Deprive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deprive) and especially [Unified Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unified Will) are just not working out for me.
  
   
The flavor text is just fantastic as well.
posts.html:

Yeah sure Cryptic Command is better but there is something I just love about this card. Went well in the old school "Draw Go" decks. I really wish they would reprint this for M11 so we can have a decent counterspell in standard. At least give us our Mana Leak! I have never seen so many request to get a card printed for M11 than I do Mana Leak. We know you hear us wizards! We want our Mana Leak back! I'll take dismiss if you would rather do that, but you need to bring back at least one good counterspell! Cancel and Deprive and especially Unified Will are just not working out for me.

The flavor text is just fantastic as well.

Posted By: Pontiac (3/26/2011 8:23:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Henrietta  
  
No sane 5 colour decks will use [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Cryptic Command), as most will run green as a main and the other colours as sides. Cryptic Command is more strict on the blue mana requirements while dismiss is less flexible.  
  
Ultimately its up to each player to decide whats best, sometimes easier to cast simple card draws are worth more than the options provided by cryptic command and vice versa  
  
I give it a 4/5 as its a hard counter with a nice replacement draw, though I would rate cryptic command higher than this
posts.html:
@Henrietta

Ultimately its up to each player to decide whats best, sometimes easier to cast simple card draws are worth more than the options provided by cryptic command and vice versa

I give it a 4/5 as its a hard counter with a nice replacement draw, though I would rate cryptic command higher than this

Posted By: bowlofgumbo (9/10/2011 10:45:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: An amazing card--this effectively says "no" to a spell played by your opponent without the loss of card advantage. It is a little costly in terms of mana, but unlike the modern equivalent [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic Command) its quite easy to play this in a multicolored deck as it only requires 2 blue mana to cast. Funny flavor text, but I don't remember ertai looking that silly...
posts.html:

It is a little costly in terms of mana, but unlike the modern equivalent Cryptic Command its quite easy to play this in a multicolored deck as it only requires 2 blue mana to cast. Funny flavor text, but I don't remember ertai looking that silly...

Posted By: Henrietta (7/23/2011 4:02:08 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: People complaining that this is "not as good as [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic Command)" are showing a lack of understanding about card design. Cryptic Command is a rare, was part of a series of iconic uber-spells, and does have a slight casting cost disadvantage to offset its greater versatility. There is not a single blue player who wouldn't love to see this in standard; self-replacing counters will \*always\* be potent.
posts.html:
People complaining that this is "not as good as Cryptic Command" are showing a lack of understanding about card design. Cryptic Command is a rare, was part of a series of iconic uber-spells, and does have a slight casting cost disadvantage to offset its greater versatility. There is not a single blue player who wouldn't love to see this in standard; self-replacing counters will *always* be potent.

Posted By: grynning (2/15/2012 8:12:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Self replacing counters.   
Gotta love 'em.  
  
Probably my equal 2nd favourite 4cmc counter spell, after [Rewind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rewind), equal to [Foil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Foil), and before [Discombobulate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Discombobulate) (if only for name and ft).  
  
[Cryptic command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic command) is too expensive for me... I can only build pauper.  
  
Still, very good card.  
4.5/5

I love this card. Fantastic. It's so simple and effective. I love how the way it says it in two simple sentences. "Counter target spell. Draw a card." Yeah sure [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic Command) is better but there is something I just love about this card. Went well in the old school "Draw Go" decks. I really wish they would reprint this for M11 so we can have a decent counterspell in standard. At least give us our [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak)! I have never seen so many request to get a card printed for M11 than I do Mana Leak. We know you hear us wizards! We want our Mana Leak back! The flavor text is just fantastic as well.
